Documents.Document: This course introduces the PFS tool. It will show the impact you can have on the consumer experience of your products. Full leverage of the functionalities of PFS will change your business results significantly.

This course introduces the PFS tool. It will show the impact you can have on the consumer experience of your products. Full leverage of the functionalities of PFS will change your business results significantly.

This course introduces the CCR tool. With CCR you can upload assets and files, for example, images and movies. These can be used online, on packaging and more. These assets improve the conversion rate significantly.
This course introduces the LCB tool. With LCB, you can manage your local product catalog.
This course introduces the OLEE tool. With the OLEE tool, you can create and enrich support documents for end-users and the repair network.
This course introduces the Syndication process. Content syndication is the process by which Philips content gets onto retailer websites. The training addresses BGs as well as SOs.

Document.label: .com Simulation
Document.target: BU CMM, BU OMM, SO CMM, SO OMM, PFS user, Asset manager, NSO reviewer, CIM

Documents.Document: The .com simulation will guide you through the Philips.com website and give you an understanding of the different pages and how to use these in your marketing activities.
These video tutorials will help you get acquainted with the SDL TMS tool.

Integrated Product Development is the process to acquire or develop a new product with a multi-disciplinary team including product and packaging development, industrialization, and volume ramp-up. Find out more about IPD on this Wiki site.

Document.label: Market introduction process (MIP)
Document.target: BU CMM, BU MM, SO CMM, BU MM

Documents.Document: The Market Introduction Process (MIP) prepares innovations and propositions to be launched in markets by our SOs. It ensures that project launches are organized in a coordinated and aligned fashion across categories and BUâ€™s.
